oai_dc:dc.dc:title: House of Blessing, 2002 February
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the House of Blessing located at 900 Gallatin Road in Nashville, Tennessee. This non-denominational church has been home to many different congregations over the years. According to the building's cornerstone the church was built in 1956 as the Community Church of God. Other names for this address found in city directories include: House of God, Emmanuel Church of Christ, and Community Church of God. The foundation is made of rough stone. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled with asphalt shingles. The windows are colored glass on the chapel and clear glass on the remaining structures. Window frames are all wood. There is an arched window above the entryway doors. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: House of Blessing (Nashville, Tenn.); House of God (Nashville, Tenn.); Emmanuel Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.); Community Church of God (Nashville, Tenn.); Community Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
